description: Triangle T(n,m) of number of labeled n-node T_0-hypergraphs with m distinct hyperedges (empty hyperedge excluded), m=0,1,...,2^n-1.
comments: A hypergraph is a T_0 hypergraph if for every two distinct nodes there exists a hyperedge containing one but not the other node.
links: V. Jovovic, Illustration of initial terms of A059087, A059088
formula: T(n, m)=Sum_{i=0..n} s(n, i)*binomial(2^i-1, m), where s(n, i) are Stirling numbers of the first kind.Also T(n, m)=(1/m!)*Sum_{i=0..m+1} s(m+1, i)*fallfac(2^(i-1), n). E.g.f: Sum((1+x)^(2^n-1)*log(1+y)^n/n!, n=0..infinity). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, May 19 2004
author: Goran Kilibarda, _Vladeta Jovovic_, Dec 27 2000
